enWisdom: Lying destroys you even if you are [apparently made] safe by it

Wisdom: الْخِلَالُ الْمُنْتِجَةُ لِلشَّرِّ الْكَذِبُ وَالْبُخْلُ وَالْجَوْرُ وَالْجَهْلُ
enWisdom: The attributes that lead to evil are lying, stinginess, injustice and ignorance

Wisdom: احْذَرْ فُحْشَ الْقَوْلِ وَالْكَذِبَ فَإِنَّهُمَا يُزْرِيَانِ بِالْقَائِلِ
enWisdom: Be careful of obscene language and lies, for indeed they degrade the speaker

Wisdom: أَبْعَدُ النَّاسِ مِنَ الصَّلَاحِ الْكَذُوبُ وَذُو الْوَجْهِ الْوَقَاحُ
enWisdom: The furthest of all people from goodness is the incessant liar and the brazen-faced
Eschew lying for indeed it alienates one from faith
The consequence of lying is rebuke and regret

Wisdom: كَفَاكَ مُوَبِّخاً عَلَى الْكَذِبِ عِلْمُكَ بِأَنَّكَ كَاذِبٌ
enWisdom: Your knowing that you are a liar suffices as a rebuke for lying
One who lies corrupts his magnanimity
The habitual liar has no shame
Lying and magnanimity don’t go together

Wisdom: يَكْتَسِبُ الْكَاذِبُ بِكَذِبِهِ ثَلَاثاً سَخَطَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَاسْتِهَانَةَ النَّاسِ بِهِ وَمَقْتَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ لَهُ
enWisdom: The liar earns three things by his lies: the wrath of Allah upon him, scorn of the people and hatred of the angels
